flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
Raised planting beds are a great solution to jump start a garden.

  • Gardening in a raised bed is whole lot less work.
  • They allow easier access to your plants.
  • You don't have to dig up and cultivate a plot of land to have a decent yield.
  • They are semi-movable and are great for rented homes.

Raised beds you find in a kit at the local big box home store are expensive and just the materials for "proper" bed construction using pressure treated lumber are costly and can leach all sorts of heavy metals into your soil.

This is a cheap and quick solution to get your garden up.

guide.summary: Using some salvaged shipping pallets you can build functional and cheap raised planting beds for your garden. They may not be quite as durable or attractive as traditional beds but they have their own charm and you can't beat the price.
guide.title: Build Raised Planting Beds From Recycled Shipping Pallets
